instruction: Identify deviations from the norm in the standardized deviation of housing affordability over time.

month.description: Date of the time series observation (format: YYYY-MM-DD, day always set to 01).

hpi_value.description: Nominal Housing Price Index (HPI) value for the given month.

hpi_yoy_pct_chg.description: Year-over-year percentage change in nominal HPI. Computed as: [HPI(t) / HPI(t-12)] - 1.

hpi_distance.description: The normalized distance of hpi_value from a long term linear trend. Units are in standard deviations from the mean

hpi_returns.description: Monthly return of the nominal HPI. Computed as: HPI(t) / HPI(t-1).

hpi_real.description: Real (inflation-adjusted) Housing Price Index, calculated by adjusting the nominal HPI for CPI-based inflation.

hpi_trend.description: Long-term linear trend in the nominal HPI.

afford_detrended.description: Normalized distance of the affordability metric (afford_pmt) relative to its long-term trend. Units are standard deviations.

afford_pmt.description: Affordability value, defined as the percentage of median household income needed to afford the median home payment on a 30-year fixed mortgage with 20% down.

acceleration_value.description: Monthly change in the velocity of the HPI. Represents second-order rate of change.

velocity_value.description: Smoothed year-over-year change in the nominal HPI.

risk.description: Model-derived probability that HPI will be lower in 12 months. Formally: P[HPI(t) < HPI(t+12)].

month.description: Date of the time series observation (format: YYYY-MM-DD, day always set to 01).

hpi_value.description: Nominal Housing Price Index (HPI) value for the given month.

hpi_yoy_pct_chg.description: Year-over-year percentage change in nominal HPI. Computed as: [HPI(t) / HPI(t-12)] - 1.

hpi_distance.description: The normalized distance of hpi_value from a long term linear trend. Units are in standard deviations from the mean

hpi_returns.description: Monthly return of the nominal HPI. Computed as: HPI(t) / HPI(t-1).

hpi_real.description: Real (inflation-adjusted) Housing Price Index, calculated by adjusting the nominal HPI for CPI-based inflation.

hpi_trend.description: Long-term linear trend in the nominal HPI.

afford_detrended.description: Normalized distance of the affordability metric (afford_pmt) relative to its long-term trend. Units are standard deviations.

afford_pmt.description: Affordability value, defined as the percentage of median household income needed to afford the median home payment on a 30-year fixed mortgage with 20% down.

acceleration_value.description: Monthly change in the velocity of the HPI. Represents second-order rate of change.

velocity_value.description: Smoothed year-over-year change in the nominal HPI.

risk.description: Model-derived probability that HPI will be lower in 12 months. Formally: P[HPI(t) < HPI(t+12)].

hpi_trend.description: Long-term linear trend in the nominal HPI.

afford_pmt.description: Affordability value, defined as the percentage of median household income needed to afford the median home payment on a 30-year fixed mortgage with 20% down.

acceleration_value.description: Monthly change in the velocity of the HPI. Represents second-order rate of change.

velocity_value.description: Smoothed year-over-year change in the nominal HPI.

risk.description: Model-derived probability that HPI will be lower in 12 months. Formally: P[HPI(t) < HPI(t+12)].

hpi_returns.description: Monthly return of the nominal HPI. Computed as: HPI(t) / HPI(t-1).

hpi_real.description: Real (inflation-adjusted) Housing Price Index, calculated by adjusting the nominal HPI for CPI-based inflation.

hpi_trend.description: Long-term linear trend in the nominal HPI.

afford_detrended.description: Normalized distance of the affordability metric (afford_pmt) relative to its long-term trend. Units are standard deviations.

afford_pmt.description: Affordability value, defined as the percentage of median household income needed to afford the median home payment on a 30-year fixed mortgage with 20% down.

acceleration_value.description: Monthly change in the velocity of the HPI. Represents second-order rate of change.

velocity_value.description: Smoothed year-over-year change in the nominal HPI.

risk.description: Model-derived probability that HPI will be lower in 12 months. Formally: P[HPI(t) < HPI(t+12)].

month.description: Date of the time series observation (format: YYYY-MM-DD, day always set to 01).

hpi_value.description: Nominal Housing Price Index (HPI) value for the given month.

hpi_yoy_pct_chg.description: Year-over-year percentage change in nominal HPI. Computed as: [HPI(t) / HPI(t-12)] - 1.

hpi_distance.description: The normalized distance of hpi_value from a long term linear trend. Units are in standard deviations from the mean

hpi_returns.description: Monthly return of the nominal HPI. Computed as: HPI(t) / HPI(t-1).

hpi_real.description: Real (inflation-adjusted) Housing Price Index, calculated by adjusting the nominal HPI for CPI-based inflation.

hpi_trend.description: Long-term linear trend in the nominal HPI.

afford_detrended.description: Normalized distance of the affordability metric (afford_pmt) relative to its long-term trend. Units are standard deviations.

afford_pmt.description: Affordability value, defined as the percentage of median household income needed to afford the median home payment on a 30-year fixed mortgage with 20% down.

acceleration_value.description: Monthly change in the velocity of the HPI. Represents second-order rate of change.

velocity_value.description: Smoothed year-over-year change in the nominal HPI.

risk.description: Model-derived probability that HPI will be lower in 12 months. Formally: P[HPI(t) < HPI(t+12)].

afford_detrended.description: Normalized distance of the affordability metric (afford_pmt) relative to its long-term trend. Units are standard deviations.

afford_pmt.description: Affordability value, defined as the percentage of median household income needed to afford the median home payment on a 30-year fixed mortgage with 20% down.

acceleration_value.description: Monthly change in the velocity of the HPI. Represents second-order rate of change.

velocity_value.description: Smoothed year-over-year change in the nominal HPI.

risk.description: Model-derived probability that HPI will be lower in 12 months. Formally: P[HPI(t) < HPI(t+12)].

risk.description: Model-derived probability that HPI will be lower in 12 months. Formally: P[HPI(t) < HPI(t+12)].

hpi_distance.description: The normalized distance of hpi_value from a long term linear trend. Units are in standard deviations from the mean

hpi_returns.description: Monthly return of the nominal HPI. Computed as: HPI(t) / HPI(t-1).

hpi_real.description: Real (inflation-adjusted) Housing Price Index, calculated by adjusting the nominal HPI for CPI-based inflation.

hpi_trend.description: Long-term linear trend in the nominal HPI.

afford_detrended.description: Normalized distance of the affordability metric (afford_pmt) relative to its long-term trend. Units are standard deviations.

afford_pmt.description: Affordability value, defined as the percentage of median household income needed to afford the median home payment on a 30-year fixed mortgage with 20% down.

acceleration_value.description: Monthly change in the velocity of the HPI. Represents second-order rate of change.

velocity_value.description: Smoothed year-over-year change in the nominal HPI.

risk.description: Model-derived probability that HPI will be lower in 12 months. Formally: P[HPI(t) < HPI(t+12)].

hpi_returns.description: Monthly return of the nominal HPI. Computed as: HPI(t) / HPI(t-1).

hpi_real.description: Real (inflation-adjusted) Housing Price Index, calculated by adjusting the nominal HPI for CPI-based inflation.

hpi_trend.description: Long-term linear trend in the nominal HPI.

afford_detrended.description: Normalized distance of the affordability metric (afford_pmt) relative to its long-term trend. Units are standard deviations.

afford_pmt.description: Affordability value, defined as the percentage of median household income needed to afford the median home payment on a 30-year fixed mortgage with 20% down.

acceleration_value.description: Monthly change in the velocity of the HPI. Represents second-order rate of change.

velocity_value.description: Smoothed year-over-year change in the nominal HPI.

risk.description: Model-derived probability that HPI will be lower in 12 months. Formally: P[HPI(t) < HPI(t+12)].

hpi_trend.description: Long-term linear trend in the nominal HPI.

afford_detrended.description: Normalized distance of the affordability metric (afford_pmt) relative to its long-term trend. Units are standard deviations.

afford_pmt.description: Affordability value, defined as the percentage of median household income needed to afford the median home payment on a 30-year fixed mortgage with 20% down.

acceleration_value.description: Monthly change in the velocity of the HPI. Represents second-order rate of change.

velocity_value.description: Smoothed year-over-year change in the nominal HPI.

risk.description: Model-derived probability that HPI will be lower in 12 months. Formally: P[HPI(t) < HPI(t+12)].

hpi_yoy_pct_chg.description: Year-over-year percentage change in nominal HPI. Computed as: [HPI(t) / HPI(t-12)] - 1.

hpi_distance.description: The normalized distance of hpi_value from a long term linear trend. Units are in standard deviations from the mean

hpi_returns.description: Monthly return of the nominal HPI. Computed as: HPI(t) / HPI(t-1).

hpi_real.description: Real (inflation-adjusted) Housing Price Index, calculated by adjusting the nominal HPI for CPI-based inflation.

hpi_trend.description: Long-term linear trend in the nominal HPI.

afford_detrended.description: Normalized distance of the affordability metric (afford_pmt) relative to its long-term trend. Units are standard deviations.

afford_pmt.description: Affordability value, defined as the percentage of median household income needed to afford the median home payment on a 30-year fixed mortgage with 20% down.

acceleration_value.description: Monthly change in the velocity of the HPI. Represents second-order rate of change.

velocity_value.description: Smoothed year-over-year change in the nominal HPI.

risk.description: Model-derived probability that HPI will be lower in 12 months. Formally: P[HPI(t) < HPI(t+12)].

hpi_returns.description: Monthly return of the nominal HPI. Computed as: HPI(t) / HPI(t-1).

hpi_real.description: Real (inflation-adjusted) Housing Price Index, calculated by adjusting the nominal HPI for CPI-based inflation.

hpi_trend.description: Long-term linear trend in the nominal HPI.

afford_detrended.description: Normalized distance of the affordability metric (afford_pmt) relative to its long-term trend. Units are standard deviations.

afford_pmt.description: Affordability value, defined as the percentage of median household income needed to afford the median home payment on a 30-year fixed mortgage with 20% down.

acceleration_value.description: Monthly change in the velocity of the HPI. Represents second-order rate of change.

velocity_value.description: Smoothed year-over-year change in the nominal HPI.

risk.description: Model-derived probability that HPI will be lower in 12 months. Formally: P[HPI(t) < HPI(t+12)].

hpi_returns.description: Monthly return of the nominal HPI. Computed as: HPI(t) / HPI(t-1).

hpi_real.description: Real (inflation-adjusted) Housing Price Index, calculated by adjusting the nominal HPI for CPI-based inflation.

hpi_trend.description: Long-term linear trend in the nominal HPI.

afford_detrended.description: Normalized distance of the affordability metric (afford_pmt) relative to its long-term trend. Units are standard deviations.

afford_pmt.description: Affordability value, defined as the percentage of median household income needed to afford the median home payment on a 30-year fixed mortgage with 20% down.

acceleration_value.description: Monthly change in the velocity of the HPI. Represents second-order rate of change.

velocity_value.description: Smoothed year-over-year change in the nominal HPI.

risk.description: Model-derived probability that HPI will be lower in 12 months. Formally: P[HPI(t) < HPI(t+12)].
